Class: Render Class to render output for the simulation

Render.Rd

Class: Render Class to render output for the simulation

Class: Render Class to render output for the simulation

Methods

Public methods

  • Render$new()

  • Render$add()

  • Render$to_dataframe()

  • Render$clone()

Method new()

Initialise a renderer for the simulation, creates the default state renderers

Usage

Render$new(timesteps)

Arguments

timesteps

number of timesteps in the simulation

individuals

to render states for

renderers

additional renderers to execute. Renderers are functions which take a SimFrame as an argument and return a list of scalar outputs to store to the final render

Method add()

Update the render with new simulation data

Usage

Render$add(name, value, timestep)

Arguments

name

the variable to render

value

the value to store for the variable

timestep

the timestep of the data point

Method to_dataframe()

Make a dataframe for the render

Usage

Render$to_dataframe()

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

Render$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.

  • Methods
